label: Description
value: Miser's purse crocheted in pink silk and silver metallic threads, with silk and silver rings and a three-ball tassel at one end.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal threads Technique: crochet

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Harley Lord Stowell

label: Description
value: Ladies bag crocheted in bands of gray, yellow and tan silk with glass beads, strung on silk and used as tassels; crocheted cord at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, glass beads Technique: beaded crochet

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Harley Lord Stowell

label: Description
value: Ladies bag, knitted in linen with copper beads; silk and metal thread lace at upper edge; lined with yellow silk, drawstring of metal braid; two brass leaf ornaments at bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, copper beads, silk, metal thread Technique: beaded knitting

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Harley Lord Stowell

label: Description
value: Design consists of a single circular medallion or rosette containing a five petalled flower in off-white with a green center. This center motif is enclosed with a similar flower with green centers but in a smaller scale. There are fourteen flowers in this outer band which in turn has a tiny heart and dot border in putty color.

label: Provenance
value: Found in old house in Cape Cod, Massachusetts.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora McDevitt Wilson

label: Description
value: Hexagon motif with light tan center containing a tiny pencil line design indark tan and old red. Border of hexagon also in light tan with a pencil line design of circles in deep tan. Between the hexagon is a continuous rope-like line in deep red.

label: Description
value: Small roses in bright shaded reds with green and brown leaves in apparentlya continuous all-over scroll effect. Stems of roses are merely green lines.Background is a two-toned narrow vertical stripe. Printed in bright red, green, and brown on two-toned sage green field.

label: Description
value: Small seven petalled flower in bright red, each on a scroll-like stem. Stems cross; at points of intersection there is a brown dot. Leaves and stems are outlined in white while the flower has a dark brown line. Printed in bright red, brown, white and gray-green on gray-brown field.

label: Description
value: Iris design in clusters of two blossoms and one bud in rose with green leaves. These clusters alternate in parallel rows. The background consists of gray and ivory stripes. Running through the ivory stripe are two inter- facing wavy lines in frosted work. Printed in green, pink, and gray on ivory field. Printed in margin: "Robert Graves Co. -6166 C".

label: Description
value: Sprays of small pink roses and yellow forget-me-nots with green leaves. At end of sprays are grasses in blue-green frosted work. Sprays have a scattered informal arrangement. Alternating green frosted work and plain ivory stripes form the field. On margin is printed: "Benton, Heath & Co., Hoboken, N.J. 1812 WC".

label: Description
value: A formal design inspired from the French Louis XVI period in a striped effect. An urn is filled with roses. Dainty clusters of roses are festoonedat bottom of urn and at either side. Also a blue bow knot suspends a blue and pink parasol. Between these motifs are two vertical parallel lines withpicot edges with little urns with roses between them. On reverse side is printed: "Side 2636C, Band 3636 C, Band 3636 CC, Ceil 2637 C".

label: Description
value: A fragment with geometrical figures is strongly suggestive of Tiwanaku IV (?) art. The background is dark tan, the design in light tan, medium and dark brown, light red, red-brown, and purple red.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: single interlock tapestry, 1:1

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Glass and cast iron building (The New York Crystal Palace) within large circular frame. Clusters of people on Palace grounds. Atop this is a spread eagle perched on shield of stars and stripes. Flanking eagle are unfurled flags of U.S. and other nations. At bottom center is globe on banner reading "New York Crystal Palace 1853," below which are a spray of flowers and a palm frond. Six fleurs-de-lys edge bottom of frame. Printed in grey, coral and green "rainbow" stripes, white and brown on a blue ground which has been applied to both sides of paper.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Notes
value: Glass and cast iron building (The New York Crystal Palace) within large circular frame. Clusters of people on Palace grounds. Atop this is a spread eagle perched on shield of stars and stripes. Flanking eagle are unfurled flags of U.S. and other nations. At bottom center is globe on banner reading "New York Crystal Palace 1853," below which are a spray of flowers and a palm frond. Six fleurs-de-lys edge bottom of frame. Printed in grey, coral and green "rainbow" stripes, white and brown on a blue ground which has been applied to both sides of paper.
Frieze with Birds, Flowers, Wreaths and Scrolls

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle showing a symmetrical grotesque design composed of scrolling arabesques and two birds holding a banner between their beaks.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase in memory of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle showing a symmetrical grotesque design composed of scrolling arabesques and a bear being attacked by hounds. On either side, a rider with spear.

label: Dimensions
value: 5.4 x 22 cm (2 1/8 x 8 11/16 in.) matted with -1 Mat:  45.7 x 35.6 cm (18 x 14 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Panel of a Wrought Iron Railing

label: Description
value: A panel of a wrought iron railing. Showing three fleurs-de-lis in the support.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving on off white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Paisley design on red cloth. Six large cone motifs on both ends of shawl. Plain red silk has been stitched to the paisley borders. A brocaded band is stitched all around the shawl. Light blue, green, dark brown, and red are the predominant colors.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and wool Technique: twill weave with supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Central panel has embroidery in design of crowned birds on either side of a basket of flowers. Carnation ornaments in corners with borders of stylized flowers and drawn work.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Table cover made of small plain weave rectangles ornamented with eyelets and joined with pieces of lace and filet.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: plain weave with cutwork, bobbin lace and filet (darned knotted net)

label: Description
value: Square of loosely woven blue silk with an embroidered border of colored chenille and gilt strips in a floral design.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, gilt strips Technique: chenille embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Band with a red embroidered design of angular lines forming hexagons and conventionalized leaves. Border, fringe and edging in red silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: counted stitch, double running and running (darning) stitch embroidery on plain weave; long end of a wrapping stitch used for fringe

label: Description
value: Design of flowering rose stem surrounded by wreath of oak leaves. Finished on all four sides with fringe in colors used in the embroidery.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, mercerized cotton Technique: plain weave embroidered with running (darning), stem, couching stitches, laid work over surface satin

label: Description
value: Embroidery in design of zigzag bands and stars on plain net and bordered with ruffle of plain net.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: linen embroidery on linen net

label: Description
value: Border of tatting in wheel design sewn to linen cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton thread, linen foundation cloth Technique: knotting with a shuttle called tatting

label: Description
value: Nineteenth-century copy of an eighteenth-century Louis XV chinoiserie damask in bright yellow with a pattern of figures, festoons and pagodas.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 91.4 x 54.4 cm (36 x 21 7/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Empire Period lampas in blue and yellow symmetrical design. Large star motif with rosette in center surrounded by a small square frame and scrolls forming a spray in each corner. Below a garland with three roses in center. Scroll forms a triangle above the garland.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 8-harness satin (light blue) patterned by weft floats (yellow and white) bound in plain weave or 1\3 twill by a supplementary warp (light blue). Supplementary warp interlaces with foundation wefts as 2/2 plain weave. Plain weave binding for white weft float. Twill binding for yellow weft float.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing a dense grotesque scene with figures with fantastic anthropomorphic figures, flora and fauna.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Strands of silk and metal thread woven in an ornamental pattern around a cotton core. a] black silk and silver thread - b and  d] silver thread - c and e] gilt thread - strands of silk and metal thread wrapped around a small core are twisted together to form a larger cord.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal thread and cotton

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase in memory of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A square shawl with a border of cone motifs enclosing flowers and geometrical forms. Yellow outlined in dark red and blue. In each corner of the center square is a cone motif with sprays of flowers. Background is tan. Long fringe all around.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: printed on plain weave Label: printed on wool plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Symmetrical design, classic influence. Oval medallion containing a pair of affronted doves with laurel bough in mouths. At bottom of oval is simulated fringed, festooned drapery held in place by cords and tassels. At top of oval in either side is a pair of cornucopias filled with roses. It is inspired from a late 18th century design. The design is printed in deep red flock while the field is an old red strie finished in a dull glaze.

label: Description
value: Medium sized diamond shaped motifs of geometric design of small broken lines in greens and browns. Between are smaller diamond shaped motifs of interlaced geometric borders also in greens and browns on tan field. Field is embossed to simulate grained leather. Entire paper is antiqued by hand. The effect is that of stencil work.

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. A geometric design on a large scale of interlacing circular bands. The bands in turn are covered with small designs as though studded with nail heads. All of design is embossed and finished in brass-colored gilt. Field is plain ivory. Entire surface is antiqued by hand. Printed from wood blocks in oil paints. On reverse side is printed: "No 8066 2". Same design as 1944-79-19.

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. Geometric strap work design of studded bands interlaced to form angular patterns. Bands are embossed, field is plain. Entire surface antiqued by hand. Printed in gold on deep old ivory, antiqued. Simulates tooled leather.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed paper, embossed, hand-rubbed oil finish

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. Geometric design of interlacing strap work studded bands in both curves and straight lines around a large voided central panel. Field is plain. Entire design is embossed and is antiqued by hand.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed paper, embossed, hand-rubbed oil finish

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. Geometric design of interlacing bands with embossed edges. These bands encircle alternately a square and a rosette, each with an embossed design center. Field is plain. The entire surface is antiqued by hand. On reverse side is printed: "8811".

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. Geometric design of interlacing bands forming circular motifs. The effect is that of stencil work. The field is plain. The entire paper is embossed to represent grained leather and antiqued by hand. On reverse side is written:"8708EE."

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. A large center motif of fantastic flowers and scrolls. Enclosed in oval shaped bands with acanthus leaves. Copied from a collection of old tooled leathers at The Hague, Netherlands. Entire design is embossed and antiqued by hand. On reverse side is written: "8396EC".

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed paper, embossed, hand-rubbed oil finish

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. Copied from a collection of old tooled leathers at The Hague, Netherlands. Large center motif composed of scrollwork with a small pineapple at the top. Enclosed in a diamond-shaped panel with wide scrolls for a border. Antiqued by hand. Design is embossed. On reverse side is written: "9002E".

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed paper, embossed, hand-rubbed oil finish

label: Description
value: Imitation leather. Large scale geometric design of interlacing circular bands. The bands are covered with small designs, suggestive in places of ornate nail head studding. All of design is embossed and the entire paper is antiqued by hand. Printed from woodblocks in oil paint. On reverse side is written: "8666EE".

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed paper, embossed, hand-rubbed oil finish

label: Description
value: Symmetrical design composed of foliage, drawn on a larger scale. Center motif subjects: an artichoke with branching acanthus leaves on either side. From the top is growing a spray of three small flowers from which spring forth three buds. The design is that of a Queen Anne or early Chippendale damask which this flock paper simulates. Embossed fine horizontal lines on background.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed and flocked on a ribbed paper

label: Description
value: Simulates a damask design drawn in a large scale. Rococo and acanthus leaf scrolls forming medallions which contain clusters of single roses of five or six petals. Wool flock design is on a field of fine embossed horizontal lines; red two-toned wool flock on glazed embossed field.
